sk.matus.ksp.guitarist_swiss_knife

Class ToneUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • sk.matus.ksp.guitarist_swiss_knife.ToneUtils

  • public class ToneUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class should handle all the request regarding tones and their properties

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Double,java.lang.String> allSemiTones
      This balanced tree contains the full range of tones from C0 to B8 as values with their frequencies as keys
      private java.util.ArrayList<SemiTone> currentScale
      Contains the progression of SemiTones that form the current scale.
      private java.lang.String currentScaleAsString
      Describes the same scale as the currentScale variable but is a string instead.
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Double,Tuple<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>> precisionIntervals
      For each frequency found in allSemiTones, this HashMap contains an interval with bounds lowerTone and higherTone than said frequency.
      private java.util.ArrayList<SemiTone> tones
      Contains the full range of semitones found in one octave (From "C" to "B")

    • Field Detail

      • allSemiTones

        private java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Double,java.lang.String> allSemiTones
        This balanced tree contains the full range of tones from C0 to B8 as values with their frequencies as keys

      • precisionIntervals

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Double,Tuple<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>> precisionIntervals
        For each frequency found in allSemiTones, this HashMap contains an interval with bounds lowerTone and higherTone than said frequency. If another frequency falls into this interval, it is considered to be the tone with the frequency the interval was derived from.

      • tones

        private java.util.ArrayList<SemiTone> tones
        Contains the full range of semitones found in one octave (From "C" to "B")

      • currentScale

        private java.util.ArrayList<SemiTone> currentScale
        Contains the progression of SemiTones that form the current scale.

      • currentScaleAsString

        private java.lang.String currentScaleAsString
        Describes the same scale as the currentScale variable but is a string instead.

      • readTonesArray

        private void readTonesArray(android.util.JsonReader reader)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        A method to read a semitone array
        Parameters:
        reader - The JsonReader to use for reading
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • generateAllSemiTones

        private void generateAllSemiTones()
        A procedure to expand the basic tones into full range of 8 octaves. Fills the balanced binary tree whose keys are frequencies and values are scientifical names of the tones. In addition, it calculates the maximum precision margins (ranges in which the frequency is associated with the tone itself) both for undertuned and overtuned frequency.

      • generateAlternativeNames

        private void generateAlternativeNames()
        This method calculates alternative names for all of the semitones. It does so by either lifting the lowerTone semitones with # flag[s] or by lowering the higherTone semitones with b flag[s]

      • bindTones

        private void bindTones()
        * Binds the tones in the tone array together: each semitone will know, which semitone is higherTone and lowerTone than itself

      • extractToneFromFrequency

        public Tuple<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> extractToneFromFrequency(double frequency)
        Given a frequency, it tries to determine which valid tone is closest to it and whether the supplied frequency is undertuned or overtuned.
        Parameters:
        frequency - A frequency to be analysed.
        Returns:
        A tuple in which the first element is the found tone and the second element is the direction.

      • getSemiTones

        public java.util.ArrayList<SemiTone> getSemiTones()
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of SemiTones in octave

      • constructScale

        private void constructScale(java.lang.String baseName)
        This method constructs the harmonic scale starting from the baseName note. The semitones in the scale obey the standard naming conventions (e.g. No letter is used more than once) It stores the scale both as a list of SemiTone classes and as a string representation.
        Parameters:
        baseName - The baseName tone from which to build up the scale

      • getScaleText

        public java.lang.String getScaleText(java.lang.String baseName)
        Given the baseName note (String) it constructs the scale and returns its string representation.
        Parameters:
        baseName - The baseName note of the scale

      • getScaleTones

        public java.util.ArrayList<SemiTone> getScaleTones(java.lang.String baseName)
        Given the baseName note (String) it constructs the scale and returns it as an Array of SemiTones.
        Parameters:
        baseName - The baseName note of the scale

      • getSemiTonePosition

        public int getSemiTonePosition(java.lang.String tone)
        Method resolves the String representation of a tone into its position in the octave.
        Parameters:
        tone - The tone to be analysed
        Returns:
        The position of the supplied tone in the semitTone array
